Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: We gained a foundational knowledge of CBT and ACT, as well as motivational interviewing skills.
-a thorough review of different techniques of psychotherapy, including CBT and ACT -how to administer these techniques and strategies with mock clients

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This was a very well-taught class and we learned so much over the course of the semester. The progression from MI to CBT and then ACT felt natural and meaningful and Mary expertly guided us through important discussions and role plays about each of these topics, in addition to giving us wonderful lectures each course. Since the class is long, I often felt like it might be nice to take a short (even 3 minute) break midway through so we could stretch or get water. The final assignment felt like a wonderful culmination of our learning but it came at a very busy time and it might have been nice to push this a little earlier in the semester (even by a week). In addition, it would have been nice just to spend a bit more time focusing on how to do this assignment before it was assigned. I feel very lucky to have such high quality clinical training and it is all thanks to Mary!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Definitely a course to look forward to! Provides a very strong foundation in techniques of psychotherapy, and is very engaging
